title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 124.6 - Post-hearing procedure
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 124.6 - Post-hearing procedure

State Regulations
(a) Not guilty finding. If the administrative
law judge finds the motorist not guilty, the clerk will enter the finding and
the motorist's license will be returned. (b) Guilty finding. If the administrative law
judge finds the motorist guilty, the clerk will enter the finding and the
administrative law judge will examine the motorist's driving record as it
appears on the official records of the department. The motorist may explain any
conviction on such driving record which the administrative law judge is
considering or make any relevant statement. The administrative law judge will
then announce the penalty, if any, to be imposed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
124.6

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
